title: Question about implementation
body:
Hi there,

I am doing some research about `Gasless Send` oracle in smart contract. It is said that the implicit gas stipend of `send()` is 2300 and input length is 0. However, I have tried many time that i could not capture any EVM call with these values. Is there any one who familar with ethereum implementation can give me a favor?

Test contract:
```
contract GaslessSend {
    event get_result(bool result);
    function pay(uint n, address payable addr) public {
        bool result = addr.send(n);
        emit get_result(result);
    }
}

contract ExpensiveFallback {
    uint public count = 0;
    fallback() external {
        count++;
    }
}
```

Calling it with `GaslessSend.pay(1000000, ExpensiveFallback)`.

#### System information

Geth version: 1.9.5
OS & Version: Linux - Docker golang alpine 1.13
Solidity compiler version: 0.6.0

#### Expected behaviour

I modify the implementation of go-ethereum as below.

```go
func (evm *EVM) Call(caller ContractRef, addr common.Address, input []byte, gas uint64, value *big.Int) (ret []byte, leftOverGas uint64, err error) {
  log.Warn("GaslessSend ============================= Call")
  log.Warn("GaslessSend", "input_length", len(input), "gaslimit", evm.Context.GasLimit)
  log.Warn("GaslessSend", "input", input)
  log.Warn("GaslessSend", "gas", gas)
  log.Warn("GaslessSend", "value", value)
  if len(input) == 0 && evm.Context.GasLimit == 2300 {
    log.Warn("GaslessSend", "txHash", evm.StateDB.TxHash())
  }
}
```

len(input) == 0 and gaslimit/gas == 2300
